answers.answer: The short term risks are electrolyte abnormailites in the long run things like diabetes, cancer, heart disease, osteoporosis etc could effect.There really isn't much you can do to help her if she isn't willing to help her self.

question: I am in my first year of college and I have a roommate who only eats candy.  Literally.  I try to make her eat fruits and vegetables and she won't.  She is always drinking Mountain Dew.  She says she gets crabby when she's hungry, but I think it's because she's coming down from her sugar rush.  She is about 5'10" and cant weigh over 100 lbs, she is extremely thin.  She is never really happy about anything and likes to sleep a lot.  What effects will this have on her in the long run and what's going on with her body right now?
title: Troubled roommate, always eating candy.
